content.description: 5 feet to the right of the large crack of Chelydra. Start matched on good low ledge. Bump right and move into bad slopers and sharp crimps. Match smooth sloping ledge, then move to good slopey jug. Gain good crimps and set up for a big move to the tiny sloping knob. Grab a thank god jug and top out.Â
content.location: About 5 feet right of the large obvious Chelydra crack

content.description: On the left hand side of the block with an obvious featured slab face. Start low matched on the big jug ledge. Make a couple of awkward moves to the higher good ledge, then balance up to the top. Mini-slab climbing!
content.location: When looking at the Tortoise Block from the road, on the left side "tail".

content.description: Start low on a big ledge beneath the blank slab face. Traverse right using nice jugs and ledges, then work up the diagonal crack to an easy finish. A good time!
content.location: Between Donatello and Shell Wax, following the large obvious diagonal crack.

content.description: This massive boulder is the largest in the main boulder field at Reid Hollow, and has a great variety of problems with some good height. Landings are generally decent, but two pads minimum are recommended. Has the best route of the area, Shell Wax.
